name: Jim Daniels
text: Our motor home broke down on highway 59 in Alabama at about 8pm. About 1000 miles away from home. I called around to many shops. The only one that was willing to come and try to get us off the highway was JB’s repair shop. Jordan and Randall showed up before they were supposed to be there! They discovered that the supply line on my Diesel motor home was cracked. It wasn’t repairable on the side of the road. It had to be replaced.They called SEVERAL tow truck companies to bring our coach to their shop for service. They were so good that they disconnected our trailer that we tow our car in and brought it to their shop after making sure the tow truck made it to us. Cummins didn’t have the part in stock and no local shops had it either. Luckily , David Burns from Pirtek Huntsville was able to fabricate a connection tube and we were able to go on our way. This was a VERY stressful situation and luckily we were fortunate enough to find really good and honest people that got us on our way! I only wish all shops were as caring and genuine as JB’s repairs! Jordan and Randall made a really bad situation much more tolerable!!! We can’t recommend this shop enough!!!

resp.text: Our pleasure to get you back on the road.  Thank you so very much for the kind words.  Safe travels.

name: Taylar TLC
text:
This is an update to my original review upon receiving a call and efforts to make it right from Marc the Service Manager.  As you all know, many businesses won't even take the time to contact a lost customer.  Marc not only reached out but followed up with us to confirm we were taken care of, even though we had to pull our truck.  He made no excuses and stated that the communication errors were taken seriously and will be addressed.  Ultimately our repair had to been completed elsewhere but Williams still followed up and showed accountability.  I would be comfortable continuing to use W.W. Williams as I have at various locations.  However, I would advise that you seek assistance from Management if communication is lacking.  I wish we had done so sooner.

Be aware that every experience isn't the same.  We had a truck towed in to this location due to the good reviews and communication with the tech on our call.  We were told that our truck would be looked at first thing the following day.  Day 1, truck not looked at, we were told someone went home sick.  This was after we called to get an update.  We were told it would be looked at the following a.m.
Day 2,  I we provided the potential location of the issue after speaking with our home mechanic.  We asked how pics could be sent to get things rolling.  We emailed a pic of the part and diagnostic which was from a recent repair of another unit with the same problem.  We followed back up after not hearing anything mid day.  The truck was not looked at by mid-day we were told this time 2 people were out.
Day 3, Calls and face to face contact again resulted in no action, the truck was not looked at.
Day 4, We went to location to try to nail down a realistic expectation of when the truck would be touched.  We were told they would try by late afternoon but could not say for sure, this came from advisement with the shop supervisor.

This has been the worst experience we have had with a WW Williams which we use often locally.  Our confidence in towing the truck was due to the quality of work and professionalism we experienced in the past.  This location has not met the standard exemplified by the WW Williams name.  Truitt has not followed up with us nor provided a realistic time table to address the misinformation provided prior to the town in.  We understand staff issues occur, especially in the current pandemic climate.  However, there is no excuse for not providing updates nor treating all customers with the same level of priority.  The business is open, there are technicians present, and trucks being worked on.  Yet, we have not been serviced nor updated with an expected diagnostic date.  The cost of being out of service has been extended due to the poor service standard.  Beware before taking your truck here.  Sitting and no communication is not a reasonable expectation and very costly in trucking.

resp.text: Thank you so much for updating this and we do hope that we can do better for you in the future!

name: Bach Wilson
text:
This company took advantage of us and ripped us off.

I am a mechanic, but I don't often vacation with all of my tools, so I know what I am talking about here.

We suffered transmission problems on our motor home on Memorial Day weekend. AAA got us in touch with W. W. Williams. I described our problem over the phone to W. W. Williams. The front seal was leaking badly, our transmission was functioning normally as long as it had fluid in it, however was leaking too rapidly to drive. The mechanic on call nearly insisted that he come out and have a look at it on site, however I told him there was nothing that could be done on the side of the road. We decided we would spend the night on the side of the road and have it towed to W. W. Williams the next day.

The next day we had the RV towed to W. W. Williams. The mechanic on call insisted that we let him come out and put the RV inside the gates, even though we were not worried about it as it was a very industrial area. The mechanic came out and was nice and spent about 10 minutes installing the driveshaft since it had been removed by the towing company. We again explained and showed him the problem and he assured us that it would be no big deal for them to repair. The shop was very nice and appeared to be well equipped. The mechanic estimated 8-10 hours labor for the repair. He waited another 20 minutes for our ride home to arrive and we left.

A few days later W. W. Williams called to say that they could not repair our RV. They said that since it was leaking from the front seal, they wouldn't have the tooling. They charged $600 to tell us this, which is very upsetting because I told them that was what the problem was from square one and several more times after that. They justified their price by a minimum 4 hour charge for the guy to meet us to put it behind the gate, and then a inspection fee on top of that to glance underneath the camper. Their seasoned mechanic should have been able to make that call right away, and charging for an inspection is ridiculous as this could and should have been done by the mechanic while we were paying for his 4hr service call, he had plenty of time for that as he was with us for an hour or less. The tooling is also a very lame excuse.

This company clearly took advantage of us, and figured they could make an easy profit without having to touch our RV. Life is expensive enough as it is, we don't need to gouge each other. I am really upset that I told them our problem from the very beginning and they still put us through all of this.
call right awaycl

text: I absolutely ADORE Brian and Tammy! They have serviced my Hyundiai Tucson as well as a second vehicle for our family. In August 2019, I had my AC compressor replaced. I had shopped around some other businesses (including Firestone, which I would NEVER recommend) and I was quoted a far more reasonable price for parts and labor through Brian's. Brian took the time to diagnose my issue, explain what he would do to my vehicle, how the part worked and why the part that needed replacing wasn't working properly. After the repair, Brian took the time to have me look and listen to the new part, showed me the broken part before he disposed of it and even gave me some insight to another belt that may need replacing at a certain point. They won us over with their communication, responsiveness, kindness and honesty. They have customers for life because they did such a stellar job! Wonderful experiences at this shop!

text:
Pros: very friendly people and they seem to care alot. Reasonably priced too.

Con: If your car has electrical or other weird problems do not bring your car here, better you bring it to the dealer. My problem was misdiagnosed and caused me a couple days of runaround and worry that i would have to pay >$1000 to fix. After bringing it to the dealer they found that issue was simply and this place did not do a thorough job when checking the electrical components hence they missed the problem. text: The staff is friendly, and the prices are very fair. I had a tire blow out, and they ordered a new one and replaced it within a day and a half. I don’t know a lot about cars, but they made sure I was comfortable with the work they were doing. I would definitely recommend them!

text: They are absolutely wonderful! I took in my Dad’s 1993 Ford Lightning. We had been having trouble with it going dead and just not running right. I will never let anyone else work on it again. They do a great job and great work! I just can’t thank them enough for all they did. Would recommend them highly to anyone.

text: I bought a lotus and it was delivered with a flat tire.  Jeff came out to my house picked up the tire and brought it back the next day to put the tire on and check the pressure in the rest of the tires. He was happy to answer any question I had!  Amazing customer service!  A+!  I will be using them for the service of my car.

text: I grew up next door to Jeff. I remember a day when I looked out and saw a 2nd gen camaro with a blower sitting a foot out of the hood. It was Jeff. I was a kid and did the burnout hand signal..to which he happily obliged. Worked with his lil sis many years later and he still remembered. Genuinely thoughtful and kind dude who exudes knowledge.

name: Bailey Ike
text: The customer service is outstanding, the people working there feel authentic and give the impression they truly care.

Jeff @ HESCO is unparalleled in his infinite wisdom behind the wheel and under the hood of a car. He has been known to pull a rabbit out of a hat on many occasions. I would not hesitate to take any of my vehicles to him for any reason.
Thanks, Jeff-
Tim @ Rickwood Radio Service

name: Eric Morin
text: At last found a shop to work on my Mazda RX-8 R3 with a twin rotary. Honest diagnosis and job well done. Think it runs better than when I bought it! Thank you Jeff and crew!

resp.text: Thank you for the outstanding feedback, Eric! We are so glad that you were able to find a shop that fit your auto needs, we look forward to working with you and your RX-8 again!

text: I have been taking my machine work to Hesco for many years. Best machine shop anywhere. Now that I no longer work on my own vehicles, I intend to entrust them with their care.

resp.text: Charles, thank you for taking the time to leave us a review. It is a pleasure to work see you in our machine shop. We are so glad we have gained your long term trust! Let us know if there is anything we can assist you with!

name: Nichole Posten
text: As someone indicated, they do a lot of specialty high end vehicle work but it has been well worth the extra to know that the work is done right.  I have been taking my now 10yr old (beater) Jeep here for 8+ years and will take my new Subaru here.  Joe is great and always has the time to spend explaining anything to you.  He even took my husband and son around the shops to look at all of the cars there.

resp.text: Thank you for your loyalty over the years Nichole, we truly appreciate it!

name: Stephen Wilson
text: These guys do some of the best work in Birmingham. That being said, when you see the Ferraris and classic cars in the parking lot you know you are going to pay a price that matches their level of quality work. Don't let the abrasive or lack of communication keep you from at least getting a written quote from their shop. On a side note, get someone to show you around their facility because it is basically an ever changing museum of mechanical genius. Custom builds, daily drivers, etc it's a pretty cool spot in the heart of downtown. If all else fails, you can walk to Good People Brewery or Regions Park  and drink away your sorrows.

resp.text: Thank you for the good review, Stephen! We appreciate getting your feedback and we hope next time we can deliver a 5-star experience!

name: Lindsay Hobbs
text:
I have nothing but good things to say about Hesco and the people working there! My husband and I were driving from Utah to Atlanta when our car broke down in Birmingham. Even though they were busy, they fit us in and got us back on the road the next day! Not only did they fix our car, but they went above and beyond to make sure that we were taken care of while we were stuck in the city. They even called us a few days later to make sure we had made it to our destination safely and without any problems!
We are SO grateful for Jeff, Joe, and everyone else who took such good care of us! This was by far the best experience we have ever had with a mechanic, and would recommend them to anyone!

resp.text: Thank you for the excellent review, Lindsay! We are glad you arrived safely, and we can't thank you enough for all the kind words. Our goal is to provide our customers with an unbeatable experience every time!

name: Prentice Jones
text: One of my best friends works at this shop so I know they are an A+ shop because Warren is a very good tech.

resp.text: Thank you for the awesome review! We are so glad to have Warren on our team! We appreciate the great recommendation!

name: Jacob Hobbs
text: These are the kind of guys that would take their shirts off their backs to help you. Highly recommend to anyone who appreciates honest and high quality work!

resp.text: We appreciate the great review, Jacob. That is exactly who we strive to be. Thank you for your business, and we hope to see you again!

name: James Gavin
text: On a recent trip from Birmingham back to Atlanta my 2012 Hyundai Equus ran hot about 30 miles outside of Birmingham, we got off at exit 147 wound up having to get it towed back to Birmingham. I didn't know a mechanic in B'ham so I had it delivered to J.B. a Buick dealership, they inspected it for $309 and said that I at the least had a blown head gasket caused by a bad water pump and that it was going to cost me $2215  for them to break down the engine and make sure that there was no further damage with the engine,  and that it could be as much as $4500 to replace all the gaskets through out the engine. NOT TODAY!!! So I did a Google search and came across HESCO, the reviews were great, I spoke with Joe Molina and he arranged to have it tower to HESCO "DESPITE being in the middle of changing locations", they got it in checked it out, started it up, "No white smoke from the tail pipe", turned out to be the water pump, THAT's ALL. I can't recommend Joe Molina and the guys at HESCO Automotive highly enough, they are highly professional, extremely efficient, keep you informed at every juncture of the process, and very reasonable. I am telling ALL my friends and family to take their vehicles to HESCO Automotive. Thanks guys, this was a very stressful situation as I was having to take care of it from Atlanta, Joe you could not have been better.

resp.text: Thank you James! It is great to hear from you and glad we could help you out.  We want to make sure all of our costumes are taken care of and are aware of the repairs needed for their vehicle. We are glad you found us and we could located the problem to your water pump. We truly appreciate your recommendation. Give us a call if you have questions or need anything in the future!

name: Ron Denney
text: I had a bolt sheared off inside my BMW motorcycle wheel. I called Wesco from Hoover and explained the situation and that I lived 90 miles south in Dadeville, AL. I spoke with Joe on the phone. He said bring it in and they would see what they could do for me. They used an easy out to remove the bolt for me quickly and wouldn't even take any money for this service. Great people at WESCO!

resp.text: We really appreciate the excellent review, Ron. We are happy to help. Let us know if there is anything else we can help you with!

name: Ray Clark
text: I have a Z-3 and a 535i and would not let anyone else touch them in Birmingham.  I used to go to Tom Williams for items under warranty and they always found something to fix that did not need fixing.  Anything Joe, Jeff and his folks say, I trust completely.

resp.text: Ray - We cannot thank you enough for your business and the great review! We appreciate being able to work with you.

name: Dawn Brook
text: I took my wife's 07 Murano in for a few repairs and got the same great service as all the exotics Hesco works on. Great guys and service.

resp.text: Roy - Thank you for the great review! It is always a pleasure to be able to work with you and we cannot thank you enough for your business.

name: Katie munkus
text: I was very disappointed with this business. I had to have my car towed here the Wednesday before Thanksgiving. I was told that I would get a detailed estimate the following Monday. I was fine with that. When I called Monday I was told that they had already started replacing and fixing the damaged parts to my car without my permission and without my knowledge. So I specifically said please stop working on it until I get the detailed estimate I was promised and had looked it over. The next day I decided to have my car towed to a different shop that specializes in Volkswagen and Audi cars. When I called Hesco to tell them what I had decided they informed me that my car was almost completely finished. The owner made a decision without my permission yet again and without calling to inform me what was going on. I was highly disappointed that every decision made about my car was made without my input or knowledge. And that my request for them to stop the repairs was completely ignored. This business is very unprofessional and lacks the ability to communicate with their customers. I also feel that I was taken advantage of because I am a woman. Not to mention the repairs done to my car were done wrong. I ended up having to have all the transmission fluid drained and replaced bc they used a brand that is not recommended for German cars. I also had to have the tires rebalanced and aligned bc Hesco didn't properly do that either. I do not recommend this business to anyone.

name: Douglas Smith
text: Apparently Jim Burke Subaru won't work on modified Subaru's (so basically every WRX)... Hesco came through and even purchased the updated software so that they could diagnose my car. Skip Jim Burke and take your modified Subie here.

resp.text: Thank you for the great feedback Douglas, we are glad we were able to help when others fell short.

Let me mention there are ex-military member(s) working here so that says it all about what level of service you will get here. I'm now up and running and back in business. If you let it leave your shop looking that way, and if you didn’t inspect it personally, then why would you fix it right the second time I bring it back???? Disappointed

resp.text: I do apologize to Mr. OHern. If we missed something during the repair, when the vehicle was dropped off with us for the repair. Mr OHern's Lexus had front end damage. He asked us to buff some scratches on the rear of the car while in for repairs. Vehicle was completed and ready on the date promised. When Mr. and Mrs. OHern picked their Lexus up, they seemed very pleased with the repairs and bragged about the color match of the Lexus. And 3 weeks later,  Mr. OHearn called and said there was buffing compound in the door openings, I asked him if he could bring it back and we would take care of it. Several months went by, never heard from him anymore until I seen the review that was posted several months after we had spoke. I have tried to call several times and left messages for him to call me back, but no response. As far as the chipped and cracked interior parts, I have no explanation for them as we did not do any work to the inside of the vehicle. I am not trying to make excuses for us as we all do make mistakes.  I take pride in my business and customers and hate Mr. OHern feels disappointed.

name: Paul Sheppard
text: First of all, I have never left a review , good or bad until this one. Garretts accepted from me in March 2018 a check for the sum of a little over $18,000.00 for a rebuild on my 2012 Peterbuilt. Was given a 12 month warranty on engine but at 14 months and 127,000 miles later my engine went down. I had it towed to a shop for inspection of fault. Mechanic told and showed me the two head bolts nearest the fire wall that were not torqued properly. I paid their price for rebuild but did not receive in return what I paid for because head bolts that are “properly “ torqued do not just back off. I don’t know to many people that can pay over $18,000.00 for something and do not receive in return what they paid for and stay in business long after. Praise God , I am still in business by only His Grace but maybe in the future your mechanics can focus on doing it right the first time instead of bad mouthing other mechanics in your area. A proud look is an enemy to God. If you are that good then they would overlook the basic things that are so very important.........

text: New management. Used prior to change, always fair. Went by because air quit blowing cold. Asked how much to hook up gauges to test pressure and was told "shouldn't be any charge". The compressor was engaging and disengaging so i figured it might be plugged. The technician hooked it up and saw the high side was too high and low side very low. It was plugged. They tried to say they had to pull codes and all this junk and i told them it runs fine except for the a/c. I shut off the a/c and it ran fine, it would bog down when the compressor engaged. They tried to make more out of it, then charged me $45. Avoid if possible.

text: I am looking to purchase a 2002-2006 Cadillac Escalade and I used Hampton Cove Auto Services for the pre-purchase inspection of an example I was considering.  The car seemed ok to me, although I knew there were some issues with the shock absorbers and brakes.  The PPI was the best $55 I ever spent and saved me from getting mired in a long list of reliability problems and expensive repairs that would have equaled the purchase price of the car!  I haven't found the right car yet, but will try to bring a few more examples to Hampton Cove Auto Services until we identify the right one.  As well as having a diligent technical team, I have found Jaquata on the customer service side to be both accommodating and very personable.  My neighbor says she has been happily using Hampton Cove Auto Services for many years and it's very easy to see why.  I will use them again as my first preference auto mechanic.

name: Marisol Galindo-Wright (Mari)
text:
Summary: Over Priced, Took too long, Vehicle returned damaged/needs further repair.
1) Vehicle was not returned in timely manner (took three weeks. Dropped off on 2/11. Initially returned even worse on 2/26 (left car to be fixed) and picked up on 3/1)
2) Transmission cooler was damaged by mechanic in the process of fixing a dripping leak in the O ring/transmission line  (initial problem). Mechanic CLAMIED that the damage to the transmission cooler WAS the cause of the initial problem (dripping leak in transmission line).
3) Husband wanted to fix the transmission cooler himself. Mechanic said that there was a small leak in the cooler. Picture below tells a different story. Leak went from a few drops every few minutes to gushing all over the engine with the entire fluid contents of the transmission basin on the ground within a minute.
4) Had to pay for full price for parts/labor for their "mistake" to my transmission cooler  (that is no longer manufactured) on top of the parts/cost to fix the initial problem.
5) Mechanic took my orange funnel from my engine and left trash in my engine.
6) Mechanic also damaged my engine somehow. The engine made a horrible high pitched noise when I turned on my car (3/2) this morning to go to work.

I NOW have to take the car back to this mechanic so they can AGAIN fix the damage THEY have caused to my vehicle. Unacceptable as my husband has known the owner for 20+ years and the company he works for takes their company vehicles here for maintenance and repair. Disappointing.

text: Part 1 Missing parts! Took my truck in to get a radiator leak fixed was told it would be done at the end of the work day on Friday so I would have to come get it the following week. I call to let them know I’m in route and they told me my truck still isn’t done. And would be finished by the afternoon. I got there and picked it up before I had to rush to work because of the Inconvenience. Got to work and actually popped the hood to see what has been done and the first thing I notice is a bolt holding the radiator is missing along with three other bolts to hold other various things in the front down. Further investigations leads me to find no COOLANT in the reservoir. Idk what kind of show they are running down there but if you care about your Vehicle  being put back together correctly don’t go here. I am now scheduled to go back to correct their problems so stay posted for part 2.

text: We have used Mann Automotive for several years and could not be more pleased with their work and service. They have never attempted to do any unnecessaary work in order to inflate the charges. The quality of the work performed by Mann's team is exceptional.  We usually have them service and inspect our car before a long trip. I never leave there concerned about the state of my car. They have worked on diesel as well as gasoline engines for us with quality work on both. We have recommended Mann's to family and friends who are equally satisfied. name: J Steverson
text: I am saddened that it has become commonplace to mislead or better put lie either for convenience or ineptitude. Took my driveshaft to this establishment the first week of december knowing the stub on the front was bent. After a couple of weeks i called and was told that it was being worked on and that parts that had been ordered had not come in.  Called a few days later and was told that one little part was still on order.  The next week i called and was told the shaft was chucked up and they were doing the runout on it and they would call when it was done.  Got no call. Called the next week and was told that they weren't  going to lie to me and that while working on it they bent it and would have to order another shaft and would call when they had it done. No call. Called the next week and was told it was back togeather and was chucked up doing a balancing check and they would call when done. No call. Finally i went and retrived the driveshaft. Nothing had been done. No new parts. No tooling marks indicating any work whatsoever had been done.  Six weeks they had the drive shaft. A lot of grief for what? To have said we cant fix it or whatever the reason would have been the right thing to do. The drive shaft was not touched!!!!

name: Kevin Krouse
text:
Disclaimer: This is not intended as bad mouthing. It is purely a report of the facts.*** Okay, I literally walked into the shop. The employees were not rude, so a plus for that. I asked for a quote for Rancho shocks (all four) for my 2001 Dodge Ram 1500. They wanted to sell me each shock for $175/piece. Yes, $175 for one shock X4. Additionally they wanted to charge $14.96 for shop supplies. $715 for parts (including shop supplies...) On top, they wanted $296.97 for labor to install the shocks.

Bottom line: Those shocks are going for $75/shock on Amazon. I understand and support a small mark up. Everybody must make money. However, charging $100 for mark up?? I recommend military personnel boycott this place. I have no bias against this place. I'm not from here, and have no past dealings with them. That is all.

I've attached the estimate for your viewing pleasure.

resp.text: Mr. Krouch, we apologize for your experience. That is not how we do business. We support our military 100%. We would like to have the opportunity to make it right. Please, give us a call or come by during business hours today and we will do our best to make it right.

The pickup is now repaired and I can't remember when it has run so well. The total cost of repair was most reasonable for what they did.  Thank you Performance and especially Lawrence! I called Derrick for advise, explained everything of my issue and what I was being told at freightliner. He had the patience to hear me out and the knowledge to pinpoint my root cause. So I bought the part he told me would fix my issue and he came out to the FlyingJ to replace it.  Less then an hour my truck was running and I was confident I would not have the issue again.  Without  a doubt his work did the job. Ive pickup my first load in two weeks and heading home finally. I wish I had gone to him first. I would have made it home for Mother's Day and I would have been making money instead of giving it to those crooks at Freightliner. I hope this review keeps others from making the error I made in taking my truck to Freightliner... just call Derrick... and get rolling making money and back home to your family.

text:
I was having problems with my 2014 Dodge 6.7 diesel.  Stopped at City Diesel while traveling from Kentucky to Florida.  They are normally very busy but they got me in the shop and back on the road in just a few hours.  Highly recommend this company if you want top notch work.  My turbo actuator is working perfectly now since it was replaced. The truck pulls great and the exhaust brake works better than ever.
Big thanks to the crew at City Diesel!!

name: John Bell II
text:
Outstanding work done on my 6.0, Bennett Clark, called and explained what work was done. He is very knowledgeable and explained my engine and it's repair in understandable terms.
I have been doing business with City Diesel since 1999, they know Diesel engines! They are very honest and reliable , great mechanical business. I can not say enough about them being trustworthy and reputable, I highly recommend City Diesel.

resp.text: Thank you for the feedback.  We do appreciate hearing back from our customers.  I'll let Bennett know you were pleased.

name: Jane Smith
text: Were supposed to do an entire motor rebuild and instead replaced very few parts new resulting in an engine failure .. terrible costumer service.. just a plain rip off

resp.text: Jane Smith, is that the name you did business with us under?  I do not have any record of any transaction and we keep great records.  On the off chance that this is a real review under a pseudonym we keep excellent records and have a good warranty policy and any engine repair we did would be covered by warranty.   I would be happy to sit down with you and go over what was replaced and what warranty options you have.  Of course this would require this to be a legitimate review that has actually done business with us. Having only 3 reviews all of them one star and hundreds if not thousands of miles apart seems suspicious.  In the future I would recommend a more convincing fake name and maybe use a different profile for reviews in New York  and Alabama when you are leaving fictitious reviews.
